page.title: 12CHANGING LIFE IN A VILLAGE
page.content: There has been a settlement at Lutton since Saxon times, when the village was at the very edge of the sea.The present church, built in the thirteenth century, and named after St.Nicholas, is a tenuous link with the villages sea-faring past.The sea is now some two miles distant, and the surrounding landscape is not one of marshes, but of rich and fertile agricultural land.Life in the village has changed immensely over the last thirty years, and many inhabitants remember the days of non-mechanised farming.Social life in the village has changed little,the village church,pub and school being the centre s of village social functions.The village shop and mobile businesses provide most residents with their needs,but most major shopping expeditions make for King's Lynn,Wisbech or Spalding.
